title: Air pollution kills 1,200 children in Europe a year according to the EU's environmental agency
description: Ninety-seven percent of the urban population were in 2021 exposed to air that did not meet WHO recommendations, according to figures released Monday.

title: Belgium's De Croo: 'It's time for Europe to move away from a purely national approach on energy'
description: Belgian Prime Minister Alexander De Croo, who is hosting a summit of North Sea countries in Ostend on Monday, promotes coordinated development of renewables.

title: Josep Borrell, head of European diplomacy: 'The global system is in danger of fragmentation'
description: On Monday, April 24, the High Representative of the European Union will meet with foreign ministers in Luxembourg to discuss, among other things, relations with China and the war in Ukraine, but also the issue of strategic autonomy.

title: 'No study has found any effect of immigration on criminality'
description: A report by the government's Center for International Prospective Research and Data challenges Macron's claim of foreigners being responsible for the Paris crime wave and shows that the statistical overrepresentation of foreigners is due to biases throughout the criminal justice system.

title: Agnès Callamard: 'The Western response to the Russian invasion of Ukraine should be replicated elsewhere'
description: Western states are accused of acting according to a "double standard" in terms of international law and human rights. They must demonstrate that the discourse on the rule of law is not only designed to defend their interests, says Amnesty International Secretary General.

title: Kenya: Raila Odinga's opposition to resume anti-government protests
description: Odinga had been leading regular protests against the government over claims the presidential vote in August had been rigged but also over what he said was the government's failure to tackle the soaring cost of living.

title: Fashion models are increasingly diverse, and influencing designers' collections
description: At each fashion week, the catwalks reflect a certain spirit of the times, with the models themselves sometimes influencing the designers' work. It's up to the casting directors to know how to respond to the desires of the moment.

title: Pension reform: 'Maybe I should have done more,' Macron tells 'Le Parisien'
description: In a long interview with the readers of the newspaper, the French President admitted to 'not having been present enough' in the debate on pension reform.

title: 'My first sexual relationship, at 18, was marked by the notion of consent'
description: 'First times': Stories of pivotal moments around the transition to adulthood. This week, Maëlys (her first name has been changed), a 19-year-old student, recounts her first sexual experience.

title: Foreign nations scramble to evacuate citizens as Sudan battles rage
description: The eruption of fighting eight days ago between the army and Rapid Support Forces (RSF) paramilitary group has triggered a humanitarian crisis, killed more than 400 people and trapped millions without access to basic services.

title: Belgium's Evenepoel wins Liege-Bastogne-Liege as rival Pogacar breaks wrist
description: The slovenian broke his wrist in an early fall, leaving the Belgian in control.

title: Catalonia hit by over 30 months of drought
description: Faced with an unprecedented water shortage, the Spanish region is enforcing drastic water restrictions for agriculture, industry and households. But it is also betting on an increase in its desalination plants' capacities.

title: The restoration of the Shaaran Reserve confirms Saudi Arabia's environmental ambitions
description: Tree planting and the reintroduction of gazelles and leopards: Striving for openness and modernization, the kingdom is investing in a natural environment destroyed by overgrazing and hunting,

title: 'After leaving city centers to finance, hotels and chain stores, Americans are now ready to reconsider their model'
description: The Covid-19 pandemic and work-from-home have emptied San Francisco's Financial District. As the city suffers a severe housing crisis, some imagine a reconversion of vacant offices in an attempt to revive life in city centers, writes Corine Lesnes in her column.

title: Ten years of same-sex marriage in France, in graphs
description: 'Le Monde' takes stock of these ten years during which more than 70,000 homosexual couples have said 'yes' to each other.

title: France, US evacuate citizens to escape Sudan's battles
description: Paris and Washington have started exfiltrating nationals as fighting in Khartoum continues.

title: Fears grow as France eyes clearance of Mayotte slums
description: French authorities are set to launch a vast police operation to clear the island's slums and expel illegal migrants. Many non-governmental associations have concerns.

title: Extinction Rebellion activists opt for soft methods in London parade
description: Several tens of thousands of demonstrators rallied in London on Saturday to protest peacefully against climate change.

title: US embassy in Khartoum evacuated as fighting continues in Sudan
description: Foreign countries have said they are preparing for the potential evacuation of thousands more of their nationals as violent fighting between the Sudanese army and a paramilitary group entered a second week.

title: Ursula von der Leyen discreetly considers second term as European Commission president
description: The German head of the EU has begun to put forward the idea of her candidacy as her own successor to Paris and Berlin.

title: Mali: Wave of bloodshed kills ten civilians and three soldiers
description: The various 'terrorist incidents' took place a day after Mali celebrated the Eid al-Fitr holiday, which marks the end of the holy month of Ramadan.

title: Young people embrace hair transplants: 'I have regained my confidence and I no longer feel bald'
description: Younger and younger people find themselves suffering from hair loss anxiety. An increasing number of young men are traveling to Turkey for a hair transplant, where this affordable operation is carried out routinely.

title: Nobuchiyo Kishi: The political heir running for office in Japan's Yamaguchi prefecture
description: Kishi, nephew of slain ex-prime minister Shinzo Abe, is running in a legislative by-election on Sunday while attempting to counter accusations of nepotism.

title: NBA Playoffs: The Philadelphia 76ers sweep the Brooklyn Nets to advance to the second round
description: Without MVP finalist Joel Embiid, the 76ers dominated the second half of the game to seal a 96-88 victory in Brooklyn.
